CONJUGATES: uniforms (plural Noun) | more uniform (comparative Adj.) | most uniform (superlative Adj.) | uniformed (Verb past tense/pp - less common)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French uniforme, from Latin uniformis (having one form), from ūnus ('one') + forma ('form, shape').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Remaining the same in all cases and at all times; not varying in form or character.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 统一的；一致的；不变化的；始终如一的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The quality of the parts must be uniform across the entire production line.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 所有零件的质量必须在整个生产线上保持一致。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A distinctive set of clothes worn by members of the same organization, school, or military force, as a means of identification.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 制服；（军队、学校、组织等的）统一服装。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The police officer wore a crisp blue uniform.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这名警察穿着一身笔挺的蓝色制服。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having the same texture, color, or degree throughout.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （颜色、质地、密度等）均匀的；单一的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Apply the paint in a uniform layer for the best finish.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 涂抹油漆时要保持均匀的涂层，以获得最佳效果。
